title: The Jamaica Dairy Development Board Act
title_en: The Jamaica Dairy Development Board Act

provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. This Order may be cited as the Jamaica Dairy Development (Cess) Ciu"On
Order, 20 10.
                                                                                 Interpmatim

provisions.title: Section 2
Section 3
provisions.content:
3. A cess is hereby imposed on-
      (a). the importation into Jamaica of a specified dairy product; and
      (b) the trade in fresh milk produced in Jamaica.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4.-41) The cess imposed on the import of any specified dairy product
shall be. assessed on the fluid equivalent volume of the imported dairy
product at a rate of one per cent of the average f m gate price of the
locally produced fresh milk in the previous calendar year.
         (2) The cess imposed on the trade in fiesh milk produced in Jamaica
shall be at a rate of one per cent of the average f m gate price of fiesh milk
produced in Jamaica recommended in the previous year by the Board
pursuant to section 5 (2) (e) of the Act.
        (3) The Board shall, no later than the fifteenth day of January in
each year-
               [% inclusion of this page is authorized by LN. 95/2013]
                   THE JAMAICA DAIRY DEVELOPMENT BOARD
      (a) provide the Commissioner of Customs with a milk fluid equivalent
          chart; and
      (b) cause the average farm gate price to be applied to the calculation of
          the cess payable for that year to be published in the Gazette.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. The Commissioner of Customs shall collect the cess on the items
mentioned in paragraph 3 (a) and shall, remit the cess collected to the
Minister responsible for finance for the account of the Board.                      0

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.--(1) The Processor shall collect from each producer who delivers
fresh milk to the processing plant, a sum equivalent to one-half of the cess
payable on the quantity of fresh milk produced in Jamaica delivered and shall
remit the sums to the Board in accordance with paragraph 7.
        (2) The processor shall pay the other half of the cess payable under
these Regulations.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. A person who is required under this Order to pay or remit cess to
the Board, shall do so on a monthly basis and in each case within a period
of ten days after the last day of the month during which the fresh milk
produced in Jamaica in respect of which the cess is payable, was sold or
purchased.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8.--(1) A person who fails to pay or remit the cess to the Board as
provided under Regulation 3 shall, in addition to the cess, be liable to pay
interest of twelve per cent for the first month or part of the month in which
the cess remains unpaid and six per cent compound interest for each
subsequent month or part of a month in which the cess remains unpaid.
         (2) A person who fails to pay the cess to the Commissioner prior to
the release of the imported dairy product as provided under Regulation 4
shall, in addition to the cess, be liable to pay interest of twenty-five per cent
for the first month or part of a month in which the cess remains unpaid and
twelve per cent compound interest for each subsequent month or part of a
month in which the cess remains unpaid.
         (3) The interest rates set out in paragraphs (1) and (2)me monthly
interest rates and not annual interest rates.
